body:
### Problem

reading or pasting specific bytes, nvim crashes.

running bisect on `bcb17689d..64847fbdc` results 328ea02eb7dec32286ae6c691ecef71d988c905b `is the first bad commit`



### Steps to reproduce

1.create init.lua
```lua
vim.opt.rtp:append("/path/to/ccc.nvim") -- github.com/uga-rosa/ccc.nvim ref: 790aa88
-- NOTE: causal code must be in the plugin but I couldn't find that. sorry

local ccc = require("ccc")
ccc.setup({
    highlighter = {
        auto_enable = true,
    },
})
vim.opt.ignorecase = true
```

2.create a.bin
```
% xxd a.bin
00000000: a314 92f9 edb7 bb2f 5ebc                 ......./^.
```

3.open the file
```
$ nvim
:e ++enc=utf-8 a.bin
```

4.nvim crashes

### Expected behavior

nvim should not crash

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.11.0-dev-836+g64847fbdc

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no (the plugin does not work on Vim)

### Operating system/version

ArchLinux 6.10.10-arch1-1

### Terminal name/version

Alacritty 0.13.2

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

build from repo

title: segfault on specific bytes since utf8proc casefolding
